channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Education Secretary Gavin Williamson calls on Labour-run councils to open every primary school
item.description: Education Secretary Gavin Williamson praised the dedication of heads and teachers that has allowed pupils to return safely, but said he feared some children could be 'left behind'.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Seven staff at one primary school test positive
item.description: Arboretum Primary School, in Derby, has been closed following the positive tests, with the staff members, who have mild symptoms, now recovering at home.

item.title: Cuomo says he will impose NYC curfew and add 4,000 cops to the streets
item.description: Gov. Andrew Cuomo on Monday announced there will be a curfew in New York City but he has not revealed what time it will go into effect or how long it will last.

item.title: Staring at a phone screen before bed can cause depression
item.description: Staring at your phone screen when you should be sleeping can make you depressed over time, new research in China suggests.

item.title: New book claims Catherine Deneuve was one of Johnny Hallyday's thousands of lovers
item.description: MARK EDMONDS: By the time of his death aged 74 in 2017, in Britain and the U.S. Johnny Hallyday had become the personification of Gallic naffness, renowned for his sexual exploits.

item.title: George Floyd was MURDERED says independent autopsy ordered by his family
item.description: A private autopsy ordered by the family of George Floyd has found that he was killed by asphyxia due to 'neck and back compression that led to a lack of blood flow to the brain'.

item.title: The world's largest radio telescope set to commence scanning for alien life in September
item.description: The world's largest single-aperture radio telescope dedicated to searching for extra terrestrials and potentially habitable alien planets is set to come online in September after a brief trial in January.

item.title: Coronavirus: North England infection rate nearly twice London's
item.description: Using figures from the Covid Symptom Study, Kings College London researchers were able to estimate infection rates in different regions across the country.

item.title: Documentary reveals secrets of Hollywood's Magic Castle club
item.description: New documentary, 'M for Magic' reveals the untold history of Hollywood's infamous 'Magic Castle'- an exclusive, private club for magicians with members like Cary Grant and Orson Welles

item.title: Tatler dismisses Kate Middleton and Prince William complaint
item.description: Kate Middleton, 38, and Prince William, 37, may take legal action against the magazine after it published a 'string of lies' about the Duchess. Tatler today hit back with a fresh statement.

item.title: Love Island's Megan Barton Hanson dumps millionaire lover
item.description: The Love Island star, 26, was pictured sharing a passionate kiss with the Essex-based property developer, 30, during a picnic in Southend on Friday, less than one year after he tied the knot.

item.title: George Floyd: Man who drove into protestors 'was confused'
item.description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz said Monday it appears Bogdan Vechirko, the driver of the rig that rolled into a crowd of protesters, got ahead of traffic officials as they were closing the road in sections.

item.title: Coronavirus England: Experts warns end of shielding is 'rushed'
item.description: Dr Stephen Griffin, associate professor at the University of Leeds, said the Government allowing the most vulnerable to leave home 'seems to lack any obvious rationale'.

item.title: Coronavirus England: Government gives details on lockdown ease
item.description: Officers will be on the look out for groups of more than six people socialising together and will respond if two people from separate households are meeting for sex inside a property.

item.title: Portugal ready to offer quarantine-free holidays to Brits from this weekend and Greece could follow
item.description: Officials in Lisbon want quarantine-free travel between Britain and Portugal to restart from this Saturday, while Greece could lift travel restrictions from June 15.

item.title: Why SEX can ward off migraines... but looking at stripes can be a trigger, neuroscientist reveals
item.description: PROFESSOR AMANDA ELISSON: About a year ago, I had a really bad migraine that I just couldn't shift. I'd had migraines before but, over the course of two weeks, this one kept coming back...

item.title: Vatican Museums reopen to the public after a three-month shut down
item.description: The Museums, which house some of the world's greatest Renaissance masterpieces as well as ancient Roman and Egyptian artefacts, opened from today.

item.title: Ocean's Eleven-style gang member who stole £4m gems from Mayfair jewellers jailed for four years
item.description: Mickael Jovanovic, 27, was part of a crack team of criminals who tricked staff at the upmarket Mayfair jewellers Boodles into handing over some £4million worth of gems.

item.title: Seeking the healing balm of nature in lockdown, author HUGH WARWICK set out to tame a young robin...
item.description: Hedgehogs. I love them. I have been involved in hundreds of talks, radio interviews and TV appearances about hedgehogs. I even do stand-up comedy about hedgehogs.

item.title: Trump tells governors 'most of you are weak' on violent protesters and says: 'You have to dominate'
item.description: Trump told governors during a video conference from the Situation Room on Monday that they are 'weak' and need to 'dominate' cities ravaged by riots or they will look like 'jerks.'

item.title: Moderna launches second phase trial for its coronavirus vaccine
item.description: On Friday, Moderna dosed the first participants in a trial to test whether its coronavirus shot can block infection, but experts have questioned the medical validity of its first trial as well as its financial gains.

item.title: Father arrested for murder after his wife and teenage daughter died at their home in Salisbury
item.description: Wiltshire Police received a call from a member of the public at 2.45pm today following concerns for occupants at a property in Salisbury.

item.title: Woman writes about 'sad' life of 'America's most eligible man'
item.description: Southern California-based writer Joanna Greenberg wrote an essay about working as an executive assistant in New York City when she was 19.

item.title: George Clooney pens powerful essay on race riots in America and makes a dig at President Trump
item.description: George Clooney has penned a powerful essay about the widespread riots across the United States, sparked by the tragic death of George Floyd at the hands of Minneapolis police.

item.title: Sixteen insurers face court battle over lockdown claims
item.description: Thousands of companies were stunned when their insurers claimed the business interruption policies they had bought did not cover losses incurred when they were ordered to close.

item.title: Twitter users share photos of their 'lookalike' relatives
item.description: The trend was started by Shelby Contra, 23, from Los Angeles, California, who uploaded an image of herself now along a photo of her grandmother in 1971.

item.title: Oil baron 'stole £4m worth of sculptures from his daughter
item.description: The daughter of a Russian oil baron has accused her estranged father of stealing statues worth more than £4million in a series of nighttime raids on her London home.

item.title: Policeman in jail for drugs racket gets extra year for TV scam
item.description: PC Daniel Aimson (pictured with his wife Rachel), 39, who was with Greater Manchester Police, admitted conspiracy to defraud at Manchester Crown Court.

item.title: Failed stock picker Neil Woodford still not brought to book a year on
item.description: Despite savers in the Woodford Equity Income Fund losing at least 23 per cent of their initial investment, with many missing much more, not a single person has been held to account.

item.title: Man says Derek Chauvin pointed gun at him as a teenager
item.description: Kristofer Bergh, 24, says ex-cop Derek Chauvin pointed a gun at him and his friends when they were teens after one of them fired a foam Nerf dart from a car window during a game in May of 2013.

item.title: Social distancing and lockdowns have helped cut coronavirus transmission rate by HALF, study finds
item.description: A new study from Johns Hopkins University found that, from March 15 to May 28, 82% of 1,400 US counties have been able to reduce coronavirus transmission rates by at least half.

item.title: With salons still shut, we challenged four couples to cut their hair
item.description: Charlotte Martin, 40, is an employability consultant. She lives with husband Paul, 60, and their children Dylan, 11, and Meredith, eight, in Wiltshire. She says: 'The end result was not too bad'.

item.title: So in Vogue! British fashion bible swaps supermodels for key workers
item.description: Fashion bible Vogue has swapped supermodels for key workers to grace its British July issue cover, including train driver on the London Overground, a midwife and supermarket worker.

item.title: Siblings who were BOTH abandoned in red tartan bags reveal shock at finally finding each other
item.description: David McBride, 58, who lives in Birmingham, was found in a bag in 1962, while six years on, in 1968, Helen Ward, 52, from Dublin, was found also found in a checked bag in a phone box.

item.title: Gin firm slammed on social media for looting-themed Tweet
item.description: The now deleted tweet from Bristol Dry Gin, based in central Bristol, read: 'When the shooting starts the looting starts. Voted No.1 gin by rioters for its complex botanical mix and high flammability.'

item.title: 3D simulation of body more accurately establishes time of death
item.description: By adding certain data to a computer model, scientists are able to create a 3D simulation of a dead body and determine the victim's time of death down to minutes in order to help officials solve the murder.

item.title: Facebook staff disagree publicly over refusal to censor Trump
item.description: Facebook employees staged a walkout on Monday after criticizing their boss Mark Zuckerberg's decision to let an incendiary post by Donald Trump stay on the site.

item.title: Coronavirus: Remdesivir users 65% more likely to improve
item.description: The findings, announced by manufacturer Gilead Sciences today, show that a five-day treatment course appeared to have a significant benefit for patients but a 10-day course did not.

item.title: Baltimore police officer is suspended after being caught on camera punching a woman
item.description: The video shows a woman hitting a police officer at a downtown intersection on Friday. It was then that another officer, who is black, coldcocks the woman from behind and knocks her out.

item.title: Supermarket millionaire, 66, and his beauty queen Masterchef wife, 32, infuriate neighbours
item.description: Chris Kiley, 66, and his estranged former beauty queen wife Alice, 32, have faced complaints about work and noise from their home overlooking Caswell Bay on the Gower, South Wales.

item.title: Melissa Etheridge's son Beckett slid into fatal opioid addiction after nightmare snowboard accident
item.description: Melissa Etheridge's son Beckett slid into a fatal opioid addiction after a nightmare snowboard accident in Snowmass, Colorado, when he was 17, DailyMail.com can reveal.

item.title: Britain creeping out of coronavirus lockdown with friends seen meeting up for drinks and coffee
item.description: Topless sunseekers have been seen sitting in open-air communal spaces in London, some enjoying a cold beer, while others have been seen sipping coffee outside cafes in the capital today.

item.title: Villanelle's flat from season three of Killing Eve is on Airbnb
item.description: The Art Nouveau property is listed on Airbnb as 'Our house: Architects' flat', but it's actual name is Casa Ramos and it's located in the Gracia area.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Matt Hancock defends contact tracing system
item.description: The Health Secretary said that 25,000 staff being paid up to £27-per hour did not have enough work because of spare capacity caused by a lack of new cases.

item.title: Coronavirus Sweden: Launch of lockdown avoidance policy inquiry
item.description: Prime Minister Stefan Lofven made the announcement in a newspaper interview on Monday, amid growing criticism over nursing home deaths and the lack of testing.

item.title: Emirates president warns it could take up to four years to rebuild the airline's entire network
item.description: Tim Clark said that the current period would be the most difficult in the Dubai-based airline's history, but he said that the industry could start to recover by summer 2021 if a vaccine was developed.

item.title: The world demands justice for George Floyd: Thousands of protesters from Berlin to New Zealand
item.description: Thousands rallied outside the US embassies in London, Copenhagen and Berlin, chanting 'I can't breathe,' the words Floyd gasped as a white cop knelt on his neck in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

item.title: Pageant wife of Derek Chauvin doesn't want a penny in their divorce
item.description: The wife of 'killer cop' Derek Chauvin followed through with her vow to divorce him today, insisting in a bombshell court filing that she doesn't want a penny from the shamed ex-cop.

item.title: George Floyd: Three UK teenagers who mocked death arrested
item.description: The trio, all from Gateshead, Tyne and Wear, caused outrage after a photo of them recreating how George Floyd died at the hands of a police officer.

item.title: Vaccine shortage as 'mutant' blood-sucking ticks plague Russia
item.description: In one region of Siberia, Russia, there is reportedly 428 times more ticks (pictured in a container in a laboratory) than usual, reports from the Russian defence ministry's own newspaper suggest.

item.title: Restaurant in Netherlands will use robot waiters to help comply with with social-distancing rules
item.description: The restaurants pair of robotic waiters will pick up dishes, serve food, and greet customers with 'hello and welcome' once the restaurant, and others in the country, work to reopen this week.
item.media:description: Leah Hu, left, and her brother Leon demonstrate the use of robots for serving purposes or for dirty dishes collection, as part of a tryout of measures to respect social distancing and help curb the spread of the COVID-19 coronavirus, at the family's Royal Palace restaurant in Renesse, south-western Netherlands, Wednesday, May 27, 2020. (AP Photo/Peter Dejong)

item.title: Spain reports ZERO coronavirus deaths in 24 hours for the first time since March
item.description: Spain has reported no deaths related to coronavirus over a 24-hour period for the first time since March. The country also confirmed there had only been 71 new infection in the 24-hour period.

item.title: Paddle boarder tells of moment he rescued tombstoner who jumped from Durdle Door and broke his back
item.description: Shocking footage shows the tombstoner jumping from 200ft Durdle Door in Dorset, only to be pulled from the sea with a broken back by hero paddle-boarders Michael Wiley and Dylan Kirkwood.

item.title: Tesla Model 3 'on Autopilot mode' crashes into truck in Taiwan
item.description: Security cameras watching a highway in Taiwan captured a Tesla Model 3 vehicle plowing into truck that was rolled over on its side. The driver said the incident occurred while he was using Autopilot.

item.title: Missing Sussex nine-year-old girl who sparked urgent police appeal is found safe and well
item.description: The girl, Isabelle, was last seen in Polegate, Wealden District, East Sussex just before midday. She has since been found 'safe and well', say Wealden Police

item.title: Animals and plants are dying off at the fastest rate since the dinosaur extinction
item.description: A new study, by an international team of researchers, found more than 500 land-based animal species would be on the brink of extinction in the next two decades.

item.title: Putin reveals vote on reforms that could keep him in power until 2036 will be held on July 1
item.description: The changes, already approved by Russia's parliament, would reset Putin's presidential term tally to zero, allowing him to serve two more back-to-back six year terms

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll hits 38,604 with 115 new fatalities
item.description: The Department of Health has yet to release the official final daily Covid-19 toll. The preliminary toll is calculated by adding up the individual daily updates given by each of the home nations.

item.title: Coronavirus England: IKEA opens to THREE-HOUR queues
item.description: The car park at Ikea in Wembley, north London, which was until recently a coronavirus test centre, was full of customer cars this morning.

item.title: New Ebola epidemic is declared in DR Congo, hundreds of miles from country's ongoing outbreak
item.description: Health Minister Eteni Longondo said four people who died in Mbandaka had tested positive at the national biomedical laboratory in the capital Kinshasa.

item.title: Senior Tories call for daily No10 coronavirus briefings to be scaled back
item.description: One MP warned that having the updates seven days a week was creating pressure for announcements, whether there was anything to say or not.

item.title: Giant magnetic spots on the surface of extremely hot stars trigger giant flares, study shows
item.description: Researchers used the so-called Very Large Telescope in Chile to study a special kind of star found in distant stellar cluster - and found that their brightness changes.

item.title: Liverpool players show solidarity with the Black Lives Matter movement by taking a knee at Anfield
item.description: The Liverpool squad made a powerful gesture in solidarity with the Black Lives Matter movement during their training session at Anfield on Monday.

item.title: Police officer faces misconduct hearing after failing to circulate CCTV images
item.description: A Metropolitan Police officer faces misconduct proceedings after failing to circulate CCTV images of a suspect who went on to kill a woman in an acid attack in Ealing, west London.
item.media:credit: INS Picture Desk/INS News Agency Ltd

item.title: New video shows £195k Kent home hanging over 70ft cliff edge
item.description: Emma Tullett, 42, had only purchased her two-bedroom bungalow in August 2018, when the home in Eastchurch, on the Isle of Sheppey in Kent, plunged off a cliff on Sunday.

item.title: Coronavirus Russia: Infected forensics expert falls to death
item.description: Lt Col Natalya Shcherbakova, 45, was put on a life support machine after falling from a window at Moscow State Clinical Hospital but later died, say police sources.

item.title: Dominic Cummings will give evidence in employment tribunal showdown with sacked adviser Sonia Khan
item.description: Government lawyers failed to have Cummings' name removed as a respondent from the tribunal case. Barristers for Sonia Khan successfully argued that Mr Cummings' behaviour is pivotal to her claim.

item.title: China criticised as Hong Kong Tiananmen vigil banned
item.description: Hong Kong police rejected permission for this year's candlelight rally on Monday, claiming it would 'constitute a major threat to the life and health of the general public' amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Hard Seltzer - alcoholic sparkling water - launches in UK today
item.description: Hard seltzer - an alcoholic flavoured sparkling water - became a sensation with American drinkers last year, so much so there were shortages in shops and a festival was launched in its name.

item.title: Stalker, 43, faces jail after being convicted of harassing BBC DJ Gilles Peterson and his family
item.description: Sarah Jayne Rook (pictured), 43, has been convicted of harassing DJ Gilles Peterson and his familt in February and March in north London.

item.title: Eyebrows raised as government makes sex in your home with a person from another household ILLEGAL
item.description: Now only those with 'reasonable excuses' are allowed to gather privately. Social media users are now mocking the bizarre technicality that bars Britons from hooking up.

item.title: Vladimir Putin praises female official's 'form' after she gives birth to her seventh child
item.description: Russia's ombudswoman for children's rights Anna Kuznetsova confirmed she had given birth to her son on Friday after Putin extended his congratulations.

item.title: Furious MPs blast Jacob Rees-Mogg's 'conga' plan to scrap the virtual coronavirus parliament
item.description: Commons Leader Jacob Rees-Mogg tabled a motion on Monday preventing the resumption of virtual voting, which allowed MPs to have their say from afar during the pandemic.

item.title: Sea snail venom used to create a new type of insulin for diabetes treatment
item.description: The new insulin mimics the ultra-fast-acting properties of the sea snail venom to lower blood sugar levels, without long-term side effects seen in other types of diabetes treatment.

item.title: 'Super-grippy' sole made using a Japanese paper-cutting technique makes shoes better suited for ice
item.description: Researchers led from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology created a kirigami pattern of concentric circles that folds into spikes when stretched.

item.title: Pod-based e-cigarettes like Juul make people more dependent on nicotine, study finds
item.description: Researchers from South Korea and Harvard investigated the impact pods are having on adolescent health and found no evidence Juul pods were safe for adolescent inhalation.

item.title: Interstellar visitor Oumuamua may be a 900ft long hydrogen iceberg
item.description: The 'weird object' was first discovered in 2017, sparking speculation over its origin and make-up with theories ranging from a comet to a cigar shaped spaceship.

item.title: Horse, greyhound and pigeon racing returns today - but with events held behind-closed-doors
item.description: Jockeys will be wearing face masks today as horse racing returns behind closed doors in light of the government's easing of coronavirus lockdown measures.

item.title: Grey whale sprays British diver in the face
item.description: A grey whale drenched diver Sarah Richard in the face when it sprayed water from its blowhole while she was petting it in Lopez Matteo, Mexico. Sarah works on eco-tourism and conservation of the ocean.

item.title: Man United star Jesse Lingard shows off his 28 England caps he keeps in same cabinet as his PANTS
item.description: The 27-year-old showed off his luxury five-bedroom house in an episode of MTV Cribs and led the cameras to his dressing room where his clothes, 28 caps and 96 pairs of trainers are kept.

item.title: 'He'll kill you': Megan Barton-Hanson's married lover's wedding guests given stark warning
item.description: Love Island star Megan Barton-Hanson's married lover's wedding guests were given a stark warning on his big day by his best man, in a clip which has resurfaced after she was spotted kissing him.

item.title: Coronavirus England: Chaos as some primary schools reopen
item.description: The Association of School and College Leaders said of the schools in England that are open attendance is 'highly variable', and anywhere between '40 per cent and 70 per cent'.

item.title: Toddler gets stuck in doggy door
item.description: Harrison's mother, Alarni Aitken, had to tell her 17-month-old toddler he is not a dog and cannot use a doggy door. Harrison accepts his human fate and stays inside his home in Queensland, Australia.

item.title: UK will VETO Donald Trump's bid to let Russia back into the G7
item.description: The PM's spokesman said the was no evidence of 'changed behaviour' from Moscow since it was suspended from the bloc in 2014 following the annexation of Crimea.

item.title: Adorable puppy nabs an ice lolly from older golden retriever after he stole his cone
item.description: Ursula Daphne Aitchison, 31, from London, captured the hilarious moment her one-year-old golden retriever stole the lolly from his older golden retriever Hugo, 6.

item.title: Golden retriever puppy chases her own lead
item.description: Jeeya, a 13-week-old golden retriever, came back from a walk in Alberta, Canada, and chased her lead around her owner's kitchen island while it was still attached to her.

item.title: The best deals on new cars as showrooms open again
item.description: Thinking about buying a new car now dealers are open? There will be deals to be struck on popular new models, according to What Car?. These are the discounts it says you can strike right now...

item.title: Samsung releases $1,999 VERTICAL TV that rotates vertically to mirror smartphone screens
item.description: Sero, which will retail at $1,999 in the US and UK, strives to be better suited for watching content on social platforms like Instagram and TikTok which have vertical alignments.

item.title: Poaching ruled out as 110 elephants found dead in Botswana
item.description: Authorities in the country, which has the largest population of elephants in the world, continue to search for a reason for the deaths. Pictured: One of the 12 elephants which was found earlier in May.

item.title: Terrifying moment axe-wielding raiders smash their way into house
item.description: Police are hunting for the three masked raiders who smashed their way into a house in the Middleton area of Manchester at around 9.45pm on May 22 and fled the scene in a Blue BMW 1 series.

item.title: Raving mad? Revellers dance in penned-off squares at socially distanced outdoor rave
item.description: Ravers in Slovakia gathered underneath a bridge for a socially distanced rave. The visitors appeared unfazed by the unusual situation and danced to electronic music wearing face masks.

item.title: Premium Bonds jackpot winner's 7000% return on investment
item.description: A saver from Stoke-on-Trent might have secured the best investment of the coronavirus lockdown, securing a 7,000% return on their Premium Bonds in just five months.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Trump fiddles in his bunker as America burns with rage over George Floyd's death
item.description: PIERS MORGAN: Nothing quite prepared me for the undiluted horror of seeing George Floyd being slowly murdered by a white policeman on the streets of Minneapolis.

item.title: Coronavirus England: Teachers urged to run summer schools
item.description: Children's commissioner Anne Longfield has called for pupils to be offered summer schools to help them catch up on their education after they returned to the classroom on Monday.

item.title: Four-year-old dancing boy Liang Liang is billed as the 'King of Rhythm'
item.description: The tiny celebrity, Liang Liang, has gained throngs of fans, including US talk show presenter Ellen DeGeneres, since his performance caused a sensation on the street of his hometown in China.

item.title: Man wins £1m on Euromillions with his first-ever lottery ticket
item.description: Simon Waddup, 31, from Coventry, had been shopping in his local Aldi supermarket on May 19 when he heard 'a voice in his head' telling him to purchase a Euromillions ticket.

item.title: Alexander Armstrong on 'aloof' schoolmate Dominic Cummings
item.description: The comedian, 50, who lives in Oxfordshire with his wife and four sons, attended Durham School and was two years above the Prime Minister's balding aide, 48, reports the Daily Telegraph.

item.title: Bogus accountant pretended to have cancer after swindling client out of £186,000
item.description: David Weller of Exeter set himself up as a tax agent after receiving training from a cellmate while in prison for a previous fraud. He was jailed for three years and eight months.

item.title: How to make Pizza Express Pollo Pesto: Official recipe shared
item.description: The Italian high street chain has revealed how to whip up the dish at home using béchamel sauce, penne pasta and basil after joking the recipe had been 'requested 42 million times..

item.title: Christian dad scolds daughter's ex-boyfriend via letter for 'stealing her virginity' 10 YEARS ago
item.description: An American father wrote a letter to his adult daughter's ex-boyfriend, whom she broke up with a decade ago. It was delivered to the house the man now lives in with his wife of seven years.

item.title: Russia approves 'game-changer' antiviral drug to treat coronavirus
item.description: Russian officials modified a version of the generic drug favipiravir, a drug designed to treat flu in Japan, to make it specifically for Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: Italian doctors say samples of virus getting weaker
item.description: Doctors in Italy said patient samples they are analysing now contain significantly smaller amounts of the coronavirus than the ones they saw during the peak of the outbreak.

item.title: Amazon delivery driver says prayer for baby boy whose medical supplies she is delivering
item.description: Delivery driver Monica Salinas, 41, was captured saying a prayer for nine-month-old Lucas Pearson on his parents' porch in Nampa, Idaho, as she left essential medical supplies at their door.

item.title: Charlotte Church urges parents to keep their children at home
item.description: The 34-year-old mother of two's extraordinary Twitter outburst came despite the singer living in Wales where schools will remain closed until September.

item.title: Iranians are told to 'prepare for the worst' as country faces second wave of coronavirus
item.description: The Islamic Republic, one of the worst-hit countries in the Middle East, started easing its lockdown in April after a drop in deaths.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: How the High Street might look after reopening
item.description: Town halls have been ordered to overhaul busy shopping areas before retailers resume trading in a fortnight and the amount of cars on high streets may even be limited.

item.title: Twenty-stone vegan shows off transformation after losing nine stone
item.description: Harvey Quirke, 26, from London, ballooned to 20 st after enjoying a diet of junk food and litres of coke a day. He credits exercise and a healthy vegan diet with helping him drop to just 11st 8lbs.

item.title: Surrey Police mock supercar driver for crashing his McLaren worth £150,000 into wall in 40mph zone
item.description: The motorist left the 204mph McLaren 570S embedded in bricks as he stood next to the wreckage with a woman in Staines, Surrey, late last night (pictured).

item.title: TikTok user goes viral with clever hack which reveals how to tie your shoelace
item.description: Hannah Warling, from LA, racked up over 31,000 viewers with her simple alternative to tying your shoelaces - which takes just three seconds.

item.title: Nevada home to 246M-year-old fossil of pregnant ichthyosaur
item.description: Scientists have described a 246 million-year-old extinct marine reptile, which died with its unborn offspring, as a new species.

item.title: Five new drugs to be trialled on NHS Covid-19 patients
item.description: The medicines will each be tested on 60 NHS patients across the UK in the Government-run ACCORD trial. Bemcentinib was the first drug to be selected.

item.title: Woman reveals how she turned her tiny outdoor space and into a little piece of heaven
item.description: Levi Horton, from Wigan, told the Facebook group We Love Mrs Hinch how she and her partner Levi transformed their outdoor space with fake grass and wooden pallets, to create decking and planters.

item.title: Marine species are edging closer to Earth's poles at an average pace of 3.7 miles per year
item.description: Analysis by French researchers have revealed that marine species are migrating northward around six times faster than their land-based counterparts.

item.title: Chinese state media accuses the UK of waging a technological Cold War on Beijing
item.description: The Global Times blasted Britain's 'Cold War-style' move after Downing Street reportedly sought to form a '5G club' of 10 democratic countries to reduce its reliance on the Chinese telecoms giant.

item.title: Can YOU spot the worm among the birds in this tricky puzzle?
item.description: Players around the world are challenged to find the worm hidden among this feathered flock in a new tricky puzzle created by website Nest Friends, which helps parents teach children about birds.

item.title: Wikileaks founder Julian Assange is suffering from 'respiratory problems' in Belmarsh prison
item.description: Julian Assange was unable to appear in court via video link from Belmarsh Prison this morning as he has been suffering from 'respiratory problems for some time,' his lawyer said. Assange faces extradition to the US.

item.title: King of Bhutan releases the first photos of his three-month-old son
item.description: King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck, 40, and Queen Jetsun Pema of Bhutan shared their first photos as a family-of-four on Facebook yesterday to mark the queen's 30th birthday.

item.title: Sun unleashes its biggest flare since 2017 - suggesting it might finally be 'waking up'
item.description: The NASA Solar Dynamics Observatory (SDO) spotted the 'strongest flare since October 2017' on May 29, suggesting it may be entering a new solar cycle.

item.title: Defunct Sussex Royal loses 200k followers as they stop posting updates
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex's defunct Instagram account has dropped to 11.1 million followers following their retreat from the limelight in March.

item.title: Killing Eve fans are 'floored' by season finale that ended on an emotional final scene
item.description: SPOILER ALERT: The 'will-they-won't-they' storyline that dominated the plot of this series came to a head between Villanelle (Jodie Comer) and Eve (Sandra Oh) in the final episode.

item.title: How to track down old bank accounts to see if you're due a windfall
item.description: Culture secretary Oliver Dowden said the government would take millions from dormant bank accounts, meaning some may be looking to see if they are due a windfall too. We reveal how.

item.title: Viewers praise 'inspirational' conjoined twins, 18, who refused to be separated
item.description: Channel 4's Two‌ ‌Sisters,‌ ‌One‌ ‌Body‌ follows Carmen‌ ‌and‌ ‌Lupita, 18, from Connecticut, as they prepare to leave school and navigate adulthood, which includes learning to drive.

item.title: Prince Charles' goddaughter India Hicks remembers her tough boarding school days
item.description: India Hicks, 51, who was a bridesmaid Diana's wedding shared a throwback picture of herself as a little girl, remembering how she was just 10 when she arrived at her first boarding school.

item.title: Girl, four, is raped and murdered before her body is dumped down a well
item.description: The child was raped on Thursday night and her body was discovered in a well on Friday morning in Chhatarpur in the northern state of Madhya Pradesh, police said.

item.title: Girl, 16, is hacked to death with a machete in honour killing 'by her two "outraged" brothers'
item.description: Rosmini binti Darwis was killed on the island of Sulawesi last month after she confessed to an affair with a 45-year-old relative. Her brothers, Rahman, 30, and Surianto, 20, have been charged with murder.

item.title: Saudi sheikh 'sent 17 cheques that bounced' as casino pursued him for £2million gambling debt
item.description: Sheikh Salah Hamdan Albluewi, 52, who is accused of failing to settle his £2 million gabling debt with Les Ambassadeurs Club in Mayfair, 'sent 17 cheques that bounced', the casino has claimed.

item.title: Manchester mum shares sick troll's messages to disabled son urging him to 'kill himself'
item.description: Simon Bradley, from Manchester, was born with a condition that has left him with mental and physical disabilities. When he tried to share his experience with the condition online, a vile troll began to abuse him.

item.title: Mischievous boy, four, is rescued by kind stranger after he gets stuck inside a tree
item.description: Finley Ibrahim, four, was exploring the woods in Eastham Country Park, Merseyside, with his mother and two of his brothers when he slithered into a hole in a tree trunk and couldn't get back out.

item.title: Looking at your phone while walking will be ILLEGAL under new laws being considered in Japan
item.description: Councillors in the city of Yamato are set to vote on a proposal to ban the activity after research reportedly showed that too many people were looking at their phones while walking.
